text: The name Fernand has been used for two tropical cyclones in the Atlantic Ocean. Both formed in the southwestern Gulf of Mexico. * Tropical Storm Fernand (2013), short-lived tropical storm that struck Veracruz, Mexico. * Tropical Storm Fernand (2019), another short-lived tropical storm that made landfall over northeastern Mexico. ==See also== * Cyclone Ferdinand, a similar name which was used during the of 2019–20 Australian cyclone season. Category:Atlantic hurricane disambiguation pages
title: Tropical Storm Fernand
